Goal 13: Climate Action
Take urgent action to combat climate change and its impacts
Key Terms: Greenhouse gasses, climate finance, climate adaptation plans

High Priority Areas: Food Security and Production, Terrestrial and Wetland Ecosystems, Freshwater Resources, Human Health, Key Economic Sectors and Services

Target
13.1
Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries
Target
13.2
Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning

Target
13.3
Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning

Target
13.a
Implement the commitment undertaken by developed-country parties to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change to a goal of mobilizing jointly $100 billion annually by 2020 from all sources to address the needs of developing countries in the context of meaningful mitigation actions and transparency on implementation and fully operationalize the Green Climate Fund through its capitalization as soon as possible

Target
13.b
Promote mechanisms for raising capacity for effective climate change-related planning and management in least developed countries and small island developing States, including focusing on women, youth and local and marginalized communities \* Acknowledging that the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change is the primary international, intergovernmental forum for negotiating the global response to climate change.

Target
13.c
Improve, as appropriate, the availability, accessibility and quality of data and information necessary to effectively monitor and evaluate climate change-related policies and actions

Target
13.d
Promote mechanisms for raising awareness of the climate change impact in developing countries and to encourage support to the developing countries’ efforts in responding to climate change

Target
13.3
Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning

Target
13.e
Implement the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change and the Paris Agreement in accordance with the principles of equity and common but differentiated responsibilities and respective capabilities, in the light of different national circumstances

AGvisorPRO is a tech company, operating in ag, based out of Alberta, addressing Alberta’s Technology and Innovation Strategy Goals. We are attracting public and private sector investment to Alberta.

We address Canada’s goals to improve the environmental performance of the ag sector and ensure access to food (Canadian Indicator Framework for the Sustainable Development Goals). New agtech developed in Canada will be needed globally. 

Our mission:AGvisorPRO will increase farm profitability, agriculture sustainability and enhance global food security. 87% of the agri-food industry sees a need for a digital tool, like AGvisorPRO, that creates an industry knowledge hub(Agri-Food IMPACT- Agri-Food Ecosystem Platform Analysis and Overview, 2021). We eliminate the need for a farmer to meet an intermediary. Our technology will allow companies to raise the productivity of their workers by 20-25%(McKinsey & Co., July 1, 2012). 

Agriculture has a slow adoption rate(12 yrs for 16%)(Griffin, 2020). Before a farmer will adopt a practice to reduce fertilizer use, they need to have confidence that their decision will not negatively impact farm viability. To make significant changes by 2030, AGvisorPRO is needed to increase confidence and reduce adoption time.
 
We address the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals 2, 8, 9, 12, &13. We provide digital access to knowledge resources, via communications technology, for food producers to ensure sustainable and resilient agricultural practices.

That's great to hear! AGvisorPRO's mission aligns well with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals related to Zero Hunger (SDG 2), Decent Work and Economic Growth (SDG 8), Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure (SDG 9), Responsible Consumption and Production (SDG 12), and Climate Action (SDG 13). By improving farm profitability, enhancing agricultural sustainability, and increasing global food security, AGvisorPRO is contributing to the achievement of these important goals. Your technology is also helping to promote the adoption of sustainable agricultural practices and reducing the need for intermediaries, which can lead to increased efficiency and productivity in the agri-food industry

AGvisorPRO improves economic productivity through technological upgrading and innovation, focusing on communication technology in the labour-intensive and high-value add agricultural sector (United Nations Sustainable Development Goals 8:Economic Growth & 9:Industry, Innovation, & Infrastructure). Our technology improves access to agriculture information for all farmers with a smartphone, regardless of operation size. Access to knowledge remotely will help industry recovery after COVID-19. 

AGvisorPRO provides knowledge resources/extension services that improve agricultural productivity and incomes of food producers. Access to knowledge ensures sustainable food production and resilient agricultural practices (UNSDG 2:Food Security). 

AGvisorPRO provides an inclusive work environment, offering remote work, benefits, and a tech & education allowance for employees (UNSDG 8:Decent Work). We value honesty, respect, and agility. We promote a positive, productive, and cooperative atmosphere.

It's great to see that AGvisorPRO is actively working towards achieving multiple United Nations Sustainable Development Goals, including goals 2, 8, 9, 12, and 13. Your focus on improving economic productivity through technological innovation and upgrading, specifically in the labour-intensive and high-value add agricultural sector, contributes towards goal 8: Economic Growth, and goal 9: Industry, Innovation, &

AGvisorPRO addresses Canada’s goals to improve the environmental performance of the agriculture sector and make sure Canadian’s have access to affordable food (The Canadian Indicator Framework for the Sustainable Development Goals, StatCan, June 22, 2021). 
Improvements in Canadian food production contribute to the availability of healthy food for Canadians and other nations that import our products. Improvements also bring more acclaim to Canadian agriculture’s reputation as a global leader. 

AGvisorPRO believes that agriculture sustainability means building a resilient food supply chain that is economically viable and protects the environment, resulting in a better quality of life for future generations. We help to improve environmental sustainability by easing access to knowledge, helping agriculture to use resources more efficiently, improve food security, and reduce emissions. By connecting farmers with global experts, decisions made through AGvisorPRO are better decisions for the long term sustainable future of agriculture. 

AGvisorPRO builds capacity in farmers and the ag industry. The platform transfers comprehensive agriculture knowledge in an affordable and convenient way. This platform will aid farmers in building and maintaining their operations. Producers can use AGvisorPRO to gain knowledge that would have otherwise been unavailable, leading to increased profitability, efficiency, and sustainability. Supporting food production at the farm level is critical for the entire food supply chain.

It's great to see that AGvisorPRO is committed to improving the environmental performance of the agriculture sector and making sure that Canadians have access to affordable food. Your platform is helping to improve environmental sustainability by easing access to knowledge and helping agriculture use resources more efficiently, leading to reduced emissions and a better quality of life for future generations.

Furthermore, AGvisorPRO is building capacity in farmers and the ag industry by transferring comprehensive agriculture knowledge in an affordable and convenient way. This is important because supporting food production at the farm level is critical for the entire food supply chain. By using AGvisorPRO, producers can gain knowledge that would have otherwise been unavailable, leading to increased profitability, efficiency, and sustainability.

Overall, it's great to see a tech company like AGvisorPRO addressing the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals and Canada's goals to improve the environmental performance of the agriculture sector and ensure access to food. Your mission to increase farm profitability, agricultural sustainability, and enhance global food security is important for the long-term sustainable future of agriculture.
